intro: Benstonea foetida, commonly known as the stinking benstonea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is notable for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most prominent in its flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its unique scent and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
